page.title: 02HOUSING IN CROSTON
page.content: {The oldest parts of Croston}are in Church Street, Town Road, Station Road and Grape Lane, and the building materials include both brick and stone.Many of the buildings originated in the 18th century although a few are even older. Early{"ribbon" development}was later extended along Moor Road, Westhead Road and Highfield Road and the most recent housing is mainly{in-filling. The largest areas of new housing are mainly to the West, especially inside the triangle bounded by Station Road, Westhead Road and the railway line.
